content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- The structure consists of 6 building blocks in total
- There are 3 distinct layers:
  - Bottom layer: 2 red blocks with arches/tunnels
  - Middle layer: 2 yellow rectangular blocks placed horizontally
  - Top layer: 2 red rectangular blocks

## Spatial Relationships
- Bottom layer: Two red blocks with arches facing outward, positioned side by side
- Middle layer: Two yellow rectangular blocks placed horizontally on top of the red arched blocks, spanning the entire width
- Top layer: Two red rectangular blocks placed side by side on top of the yellow blocks

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on careful analysis, I need the following blocks:

- 2× Block #1 (Red arched block with tunnel facing left)
- 2× Block #2 (Red arched block with tunnel facing right)
- 2× Block #9 (Yellow horizontal rectangular block)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 9
    Step4: Move block with index 9
    Step5: Move block with index 1
    Step6: Move block with index 2
}
```

The assembly process starts with the bottom layer (red arched blocks), then adds the middle layer (yellow horizontal blocks), and finishes with the top layer (red blocks placed with their solid sides visible).
